products.title: The Great Gatsby
products.shortDescription: A classic novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald.
products.productDetails: Published in 1925, The Great Gatsby explores themes of decadence, idealism, resistance to change, social upheaval, and excess.
products.deliveryDetails: Standard shipping available. Express shipping for additional cost.

products.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
products.shortDescription: A groundbreaking narrative of humanity’s creation and evolution.
products.productDetails: From the Stone Age to the Silicon Age, Yuval Noah Harari’s Sapiens shows us who we are and where we came from.
products.deliveryDetails: Available with standard and expedited shipping options.

products.title: The Very Hungry Caterpillar
products.shortDescription: A classic children's book by Eric Carle.
products.productDetails: A beloved story of a caterpillar's transformation into a butterfly, full of colorful illustrations.

products.title: Calculus: Early Transcendentals
products.shortDescription: A comprehensive calculus textbook.
products.productDetails: This textbook provides a thorough overview of differential and integral calculus for undergraduate students.

products.title: Becoming
products.shortDescription: Michelle Obama's memoir.
products.productDetails: An intimate, powerful, and inspiring memoir by the former First Lady of the United States.

products.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
products.shortDescription: The first book in the Harry Potter series.
products.productDetails: Follow Harry Potter as he embarks on his journey to discover the magical world of Hogwarts.

products.title: The Catcher in the Rye
products.shortDescription: A coming-of-age novel by J.D. Salinger.
products.productDetails: A story about a teenager named Holden Caulfield, who struggles with growing up in a world full of 'phonies'.

products.title: 1984 by George Orwell
products.shortDescription: A dystopian novel by George Orwell.
products.productDetails: 1984 is a cautionary tale about the dangers of totalitarianism, mass surveillance, and government control.
products.deliveryDetails: Available with both standard and expedited shipping.

products.title: A Brief History of Time
products.shortDescription: Stephen Hawking's famous work on cosmology.
products.productDetails: A Brief History of Time explains complex concepts like black holes and quantum mechanics in a way that's accessible to all readers.

products.title: Introduction to Psychology
products.shortDescription: A comprehensive introduction to psychology.
products.productDetails: This textbook covers major topics in psychology, including cognitive, behavioral, and developmental psychology.

products.title: Goodnight Moon
products.shortDescription: A beloved children's bedtime story.
products.productDetails: Goodnight Moon is a gentle and soothing book perfect for bedtime reading with younger children.

products.title: Where the Wild Things Are
products.shortDescription: A children's book by Maurice Sendak.
products.productDetails: Max, a young boy, imagines himself traveling to an island inhabited by Wild Things in this timeless classic.

products.title: The Lord of the Rings
products.shortDescription: An epic fantasy novel by J.R.R. Tolkien.
products.productDetails: Follow Frodo Baggins and the Fellowship as they set out to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

products.title: Charlotte's Web
products.shortDescription: A heartwarming tale of friendship by E.B. White.
products.productDetails: Charlotte's Web tells the story of a pig named Wilbur and his friendship with a spider named Charlotte.
products.deliveryDetails: Available with standard and expedited shipping options.

products.title: Pride and Prejudice
products.shortDescription: A classic novel by Jane Austen.
products.productDetails: Pride and Prejudice explores the themes of love, marriage, and societal expectations in 19th century England.

products.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
products.shortDescription: A classic novel by Harper Lee.
products.productDetails: To Kill a Mockingbird addresses serious issues such as racial inequality and injustice in the American South.

products.title: Brave New World
products.shortDescription: A dystopian novel by Aldous Huxley.
products.productDetails: Brave New World presents a nightmarish vision of a future where technology controls society.

products.title: Advanced Physics for Engineers
products.shortDescription: A comprehensive guide to advanced physics for engineering students.
products.productDetails: This book covers complex topics in physics, essential for students and professionals in engineering.

products.title: The Power of Habit
products.shortDescription: A book by Charles Duhigg on the science of habit formation.
products.productDetails: The Power of Habit explains how habits work and how they can be changed to achieve personal and professional success.

products.title: The Alchemist
products.shortDescription: A novel by Paulo Coelho about following one's dreams.
products.productDetails: The Alchemist tells the mystical story of Santiago, an Andalusian shepherd boy who yearns to travel in search of a worldly treasure.

products.title: Atomic Habits
products.shortDescription: A book by James Clear on building good habits.
products.productDetails: Atomic Habits offers practical strategies for forming good habits, breaking bad ones, and mastering the tiny behaviors that lead to remarkable results.

products.title: The Hobbit
products.shortDescription: J.R.R. Tolkien's prelude to The Lord of the Rings.
products.productDetails: The Hobbit follows the journey of Bilbo Baggins as he embarks on an unexpected adventure with a group of dwarves to reclaim their lost kingdom.

products.title: Educated
products.shortDescription: A memoir by Tara Westover.
products.productDetails: Educated is a memoir about growing up in a strict and abusive household in rural Idaho but eventually escaping through education.

products.title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
products.shortDescription: A book by Daniel Kahneman on cognitive biases.
products.productDetails: Thinking, Fast and Slow delves into the two systems of thinking that drive our decisions, exploring how and why we think the way we do.

products.title: The Chronicles of Narnia
products.shortDescription: A classic fantasy series by C.S. Lewis.
products.productDetails: The Chronicles of Narnia tells the adventures of children in the fictional realm of Narnia, where animals talk and magic is commonplace.

products.title: Rich Dad Poor Dad
products.shortDescription: A personal finance book by Robert Kiyosaki.
products.productDetails: Rich Dad Poor Dad teaches the financial principles that the author learned from his two 'dads'—one rich, one poor.

products.title: Dune
products.shortDescription: A science fiction novel by Frank Herbert.
products.productDetails: Dune is a futuristic story about politics, religion, and ecology on the desert planet of Arrakis.

products.title: The Art of War
products.shortDescription: An ancient Chinese military treatise by Sun Tzu.
products.productDetails: The Art of War is a timeless text on military strategy and tactics, widely read by both military professionals and business leaders.

products.title: Animal Farm
products.shortDescription: A satirical novella by George Orwell.
products.productDetails: Animal Farm allegorically depicts the rise of totalitarianism in the Soviet Union under Joseph Stalin.

products.title: Cosmos
products.shortDescription: A popular science book by Carl Sagan.
products.productDetails: Cosmos explores the universe, the development of life, and the evolution of scientific understanding.
